intro: Montagueia, commonly known as the Montagueia tree, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and pod-like fruits. The plant is known for its ability to fix nitrogen in the soil, making it beneficial for soil enrichment. Montagueia typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, preferring well-drained soils and full sun exposure. Its botanical features make it an important component of its native ecosystems.
